definitions: a thickset finch with a crossed bill adapted for extracting seeds from the cones of conifers. The plumage is typically red in the male and olive green in the female.

notes.text: Genus Loxia, family Fringillidae: four species, in particular the widespread red crossbill or common crossbill(L. curvirostra)

shortDefinitions: thickset finch with crossed bill adapted for extracting seeds from cones of conifers
